items.title: Mistral AI expands in APAC with new VP hire
items.author: Geoff Soon
items.summary:
- Mistral AI appoints Geoff Soon as Vice President of Revenue for the APAC region.
- Aimed at strengthening the company's presence in the APAC market.
- The company intends to invest in resources and efforts within the region.

items.title: Taiwan stocks rise ahead of Nvidia’s conference
items.summary:
- The Taiwan stock market closed up on March 17, supported by AI-related shares.
- The Taiex index increased by 150.58 points (0.69%) to 22,118.63 with a turnover of NT$301.88 billion (US$9.15 billion).
- Electronics shares, particularly Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC), contributed significantly to the gains, rising 1.15% and adding approximately 88 points to the Taiex's total.

items.title: Forrest Li confirms candidacy for SG football chief
items.summary:
- Forrest Li, billionaire and Sea Limited founder, announces candidacy for the presidency of the Football Association of Singapore (FAS).
- Announcement made on March 17; elections scheduled for April 28.
- Li plans to share details about his team and vision for Singapore football soon.
- Former FAS council member from 2017 to 2021; oversaw the privatization of the Lion City Sailors in 2020.

items.title: Catcha Digital unit to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion
items.summary:
- Catcha Digital, through its subsidiary iMedia Asia, plans to acquire 60% stake in Framemotion Studio for 37.32 million ringgit (around US$8.39 million) in cash.
- The acquisition involves purchasing 600,000 shares of Framemotion, a digital media advertising solutions provider.
- Framemotion is expected to achieve a profit after tax of at least 6.8 million ringgit (around US$1.5 million) in the first year post-acquisition.
- A similar profit target is set for the following year as well. 
- The deal aims to leverage Catcha Digital’s digital advertising expertise with Framemotion’s strengths in virtual and augmented reality content.

items.title: SG’s Creative Technology lays off 14% of its employees
items.summary:
- Creative Technology, based in Singapore, has laid off about 40 employees, which is 14% of its workforce.
- Affected departments included sales and marketing.
- The company currently has over 280 employees, a significant reduction from its numbers in the early 2000s.
- Creative reported a net loss of US$6.1 million for the first half of its fiscal year ending Dec. 31, 2024, up from a loss of US$4.1 million the previous year.
- Despite an 18% increase in net sales to US$37.4 million, financial challenges persist, attributed to market decline.
- The company is in search of a new CEO following Song Siow Hui's retirement in February 2025, after the death of founder Sim Wong Hoo in January 2023.

items.title: A deepening economic crisis in Indonesia
items.summary:
- In 2024, Indonesia experienced a 20.2% surge in mass layoffs, totaling 78,000 jobs lost.
- The manufacturing sector, crucial to the economy, saw its GDP contribution drop from 32% in 2002 to 18% in 2024.
- Experts warn of premature deindustrialization, potentially degrading household purchasing power.
- Analysts suggest urgent fiscal and monetary incentives are needed to stabilize the economy.

items.title: 20 top angel investment networks in Asia
items.summary:
- The article discusses the rise of angel investment networks in Asia amid a growing number of high-net-worth individuals seeking to diversify investments.
- Individual investments in startups can be risky, leading to increased interest in joining syndicates.
- Angel investment networks help mitigate risks, improve access to deals, and allow investors to engage with a broader range of startups.
- The article focuses on data from the past two years to ensure relevance and accuracy in listing these networks.

items.title: Apple to review AI issues at key offsite meeting
items.summary:
- Apple executives will discuss AI strategy at the annual Top 100 offsite meeting this week.
- The meeting comes amidst delays and criticisms of Apple Intelligence, launched in June 2024.
- Upgrades to Siri have been delayed indefinitely despite earlier promises of improvements.
- Related news includes: Apple aiming for a portless iPhone 17 Air and facing competition issues with iPhone 16e.

items.title: Japan-based tech startup creates 1st AI peer-reviewed paper
items.summary:
- A Japan-based tech startup has produced the first AI-generated paper that went through a peer-review process.
- This milestone showcases the advancements of AI in the field of academic publishing.
- The article discusses the implications of AI in research and how it might change the future of academic contributions.

items.title: South Korea’s chip exports drop 31.8% due to US-China tensions
items.summary:
- South Korea’s semiconductor exports to China fell by 31.8% in February 2025 compared to February 2024.
- The decline raises concerns about weakening global demand and US restrictions on technology exports to China.
- This drop is steeper than the 22.5% decrease noted in January 2025.
- The downturn follows a recovery in 2024 that had previously positively impacted South Korea’s economy.
- The decline is linked to new US export controls limiting China’s access to advanced semiconductor technologies.

items.title: Ola Electric shares hit record low after insolvency petition
items.summary:
- Shares of Ola Electric Mobility dropped 3.9% on Mar. 17, reaching 48.53 rupees (US$0.558).
- The decline followed an insolvency petition filed by Rosmerta Digital Services against one of its subsidiaries.
- The petition alleges non-fulfillment of payment obligations by Ola Electric Technologies, disclosed in an exchange filing on Mar. 15.

items.title: Chinese EV makers resilient despite tariffs, challenges
items.summary:
- China’s electric vehicle (EV) sector has shown growth despite a stagnant domestic economy and tariffs in the US and EU.
- Companies like Xiaomi, Geely, Nio, and Xpeng reported increased vehicle deliveries in 2024.
- EV exports from China rose by 46% at the beginning of 2025, according to Macquarie.
- Nio saw a 45% increase in sales volumes but faces challenges from price competition and potential tariff impacts.

items.title: Chinese EV makers grow despite US tariffs
items.summary:
- China's electric vehicle (EV) sector is growing despite economic and tariff challenges.
- Companies like Xiaomi, Geely, Nio, and Xpeng have reported increased vehicle deliveries in 2024.
- There was a 46% rise in EV exports from China at the beginning of 2025.
- Nio saw a 45% increase in sales volumes but faces ongoing price competition and tariff impacts.

items.title: Checkout.com, Tabby partner to enhance BNPL in UAE, Saudi
items.summary:
- Checkout.com partners with Tabby to improve Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) services in UAE and Saudi Arabia.
- The partnership aims to enhance payment flexibility for consumers in these markets.
- This collaboration reflects the growing trend of BNPL solutions in the Middle East.

items.title: GCash seeks public float below minimum requirement for IPO
items.summary:
- GCash plans to reduce public float to 10%-15% for its IPO, below the 20% minimum in the Philippines.
- Approval from the Securities and Exchange Commission is required, with discussions ongoing.
- The IPO could raise between US$1 billion and US$1.5 billion, aiming for a potential listing by the end of 2025.
- GCash is valued at US$5 billion and has approximately 94 million users.
- The company is diversifying beyond payments into lending and investment services.

items.title: Thailand approves $2.7b for data centers, cloud services
items.summary:
- Thailand’s Board of Investment approved 90.9 billion baht (approximately US$2.7 billion) for data centers and cloud services on Mar. 17.
- The investment includes a 300-megawatt data center by Beijing Haoyang Cloud & Data Technology, valued at 72.7 billion baht (US$2.16 billion).
- Singapore's Empyrion Digital and Thailand's GSA Data Center 02 are also planning new facilities, with GSA investing 13.5 billion baht (US$400.8 million) for a 35-megawatt data center.

items.title: Bank of Korea rules out bitcoin reserve over risks
items.summary:
- The Bank of Korea has decided against holding bitcoin as part of its reserves due to associated risks.
- This decision reflects the institution's cautious stance towards cryptocurrency and its volatility.
- The ruling follows discussions on understanding the implications of adopting digital assets in central banking.

items.title: China launches new AI framework to cut Nvidia reliance
items.summary:
- On Mar. 17, Tsinghua University and startup Qingcheng.AI released an AI framework named Chitu.
- Chitu aims to reduce dependency on Nvidia GPUs for large language model (LLM) inference tasks.
- The framework supports Meta’s Llama series and DeepSeek models, utilizing China-made chips to challenge Nvidia’s market position.
- Tests on Nvidia’s A800 GPUs revealed a 315% increase in inference speed and a 50% reduction in GPU usage when running DeepSeek-R1.
- China's AI firms are motivated to find alternatives to Nvidia due to US restrictions on advanced GPU exports.

items.title: How Asia can stand on its own in AI development
items.summary:
• Asia-Pacific (APAC) is receiving significant attention from tech giants like [Google](https://www.straitstimes.com/business/google-to-spend-13-billion-in-thailand-in-asia-ai-push) and [AWS](https://www.computerweekly.com/news/366616617/AWS-doubles-down-on-ASEAN-with-cloud-and-AI-investments).
• Google announced a $5 billion investment in its Singapore data center on June 3, 2024.
• There is a focus on local AI development to match unique regional needs, highlighted by [Rachel Chng](https://www.techinasia.com/rachel-chng-tribe), head at Tribe, citing strong education and digitalization as key advantages.
• Growth in AI investment indicates rising demand for infrastructure development in APAC.
• Challenges include talent shortages and accounting for diverse languages and cultural nuances.
• Generative AI models predominantly built in the West often lack local relevance due to dataset biases.
• Training programs like [Tribe Academy](https://www.techinasia.com/building-ai-fluency-employees) aim to address talent shortages by reskilling workers.
• Autonomous vehicles and AI-driven drug discovery are seen as promising future developments in the region.

items.title: Apple reportedly planned iPhone 17 Air without ports
items.summary:
- Apple is set to release the iPhone 17 Air this fall, a thinner model compared to the standard iPhone.
- The iPhone 17 Air may feature no ports, relying entirely on wireless charging and cloud-based data syncing.
- The release plan faced delays due to European Union's requirements for USB-C compatibility.

items.title: Humanoid bots swap sci-fi for real life
items.author: Collin
items.summary:
- Nearly 70 types of humanoid robots have emerged since Tesla's Optimus prototype launched in 2022, with over 51 companies involved in robotics.
- Demand fueled by labor shortages due to aging populations and advancements in generative AI improving learning and reasoning abilities in robots.
- Tesla plans to produce a small batch of robots within the year, with broader adoption expected in the coming years.

items.title: Uber to explore acquisition of BluSmart EV cabs
items.summary:
- Uber is exploring acquiring BluSmart Mobility, based in Gurugram, known for its all-electric cab service.
- BluSmart operates a fleet of over 5,000 EVs in the Delhi-National Capital Region, Mumbai, Bengaluru, and Dubai.
- The fleet primarily consists of vehicles from Tata Motors and MG Motor, leased from Gensol Engineering, and BluSmart also manages EV charging infrastructure in relevant regions.

items.title: Chinese data center firm seeks $3.4b loan to expand in Malaysia
items.summary:
- GDS Holdings Ltd. is seeking a US$3.4 billion loan for its operations in Malaysia.
- The loan is managed through its international unit, DayOne, and split into two parts: US$1.7 billion and 7.5 billion ringgit.
- The purpose of the loan is to refinance obligations and fund capital expenditures, with DBS, Maybank, and Standard Chartered as lead arrangers.
- Johor, Malaysia, is emerging as a data center hub driven by AI infrastructure demand, with about 30 projects in progress and 20 awaiting approval.
- DayOne, operational in Johor since 2021, previously secured a green facility of 1.27 billion ringgit for expansion and is considering a potential listing this year.

items.title: Google’s Gemini AI faces backlash for erasing image watermarks
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini 2.0 Flash AI model is criticized for removing watermarks from images, including those from stock agencies like Getty Images.
- The AI tool can erase watermarks and reconstruct images with high precision, but struggles with semi-transparent or large marks.
- Critics warn that this feature could violate US copyright laws and result in legal issues for both users and Google.

items.title: Hyundai Card, Line Pay partner for QR payments in Taiwan
items.summary:
- Hyundai Card partners with Line Pay for QR code payments in Taiwan.
- Hyundai cardholders can use QR payments at over 600,000 merchants via the Hyundai Card app.
- The app automatically integrates Line Pay features, allowing users to scan and present QR codes at various locations.
- A map feature in the app helps users locate Line Pay-accepting shops and restaurants.

items.title: Indian B2B manufacturing firm Zetwerk opens new plant
items.summary:
- B2B manufacturing startup Zetwerk opens its seventh facility in Chennai.
- The 15-acre plant will manufacture control boards for various appliances and aims to hire 1,200 skilled workers at full capacity.
- The facility was inaugurated by Union Electronics and Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, who discussed future electronics manufacturing clusters in Tamil Nadu.

items.title: Fintech firm Shift4, Toast stocks drop as market slumps
items.summary:
- The stock market's decline has affected fintech companies tied to consumer spending.
- The Nasdaq fell 2.1% on March 13, its worst week since September.
- Shift4's stock dropped 6.7%, Toast's by 6.2%, and Bill.com's by 4%.
- Shift4's stock is down 19% year-to-date as of March 13.
- Toast experienced a 15% decrease in stock value in March compared to the Nasdaq's 8% decline.

items.title: Philippine startup accelerator IdeaSpace names new director
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Alwyn Rosel appointed as the new executive director of IdeaSpace and QBO Innovation, succeeding Jay Fajardo.
- Rosel has 13 years of experience in the startup ecosystem; previously deputy director at QBO Innovation.
- Under Fajardo, IdeaSpace supported seven startups in 2024 with an average portfolio return of 1.5 times the invested capital.
- Since inception, Invested over 300 million pesos (US$5.24 million) and supported over 700 organizations.

items.title: Hong Kong sees over 2,000 AI job openings as tech grows
items.summary:
- Over 2,000 AI job vacancies reported in Hong Kong due to tech growth.
- Cyberport Career Fair on Mar. 21 and Mar. 22 will feature over 580 organizations, including major firms like Hang Seng Bank.
- 67% of recruiters in smart-living sectors are seeking AI talent, with education technology making up 29% of hiring roles.

items.title: ComfortDelGro deploys commercial robotaxis in Guangzhou
items.summary:
- ComfortDelGro launches its first robotaxi program in Guangzhou, partnering with Pony AI.
- The two-year pilot aims for large-scale deployment of autonomous vehicle (AV) technology in China.
- ComfortDelGro plans to invest S$30 million in AV R&D over five years.
- The program follows a July 2024 MOU for large-scale commercialization of robotaxi operations.
- CEO Cheng Siak Kian emphasizes AV technology's role in addressing global driver shortages.

items.title: Amazon moves all Alexa voice processing to the cloud
items.summary:
- Starting Mar. 28, 2025, all Alexa voice commands will be processed in the cloud.
- This change affects all Echo devices, eliminating local processing options.
- User commands will be stored on Amazon servers, raising privacy concerns due to past data management issues.
- In 2023, Amazon was fined $25 million for retaining voice recordings improperly.
- Users not saving recordings may lose access to personalized features like Voice ID.

items.title: US electric taxi firm Joby, Virgin bring air taxis to UK
items.summary:
- California-based Joby Aviation partners with Virgin Atlantic to launch electric air taxis in the UK.
- Joby’s seventh planned market, initially aimed at New York or Los Angeles by 2025, faces FAA certification delays.
- Awaiting UK approval from the Civil Aviation Authority after submitting application in July 2022.
- Exclusively partners with Virgin as its eVTOL distribution partner, following a deal with Delta Air Lines.
- Initial routes planned between London Heathrow and Manchester Airport.
- Virgin supports Joby with marketing and regulatory processes but will not provide financial investment.
- Joby’s eVTOL aircraft can fly up to 200 miles per hour and accommodates a pilot and four passengers.

items.title: NZ AI startup ListAssist acquired by US software firm
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- New Zealand-based AI startup ListAssist acquired by Inside Real Estate, a Utah-based software company.
- Financial details of the acquisition remain undisclosed.
- ListAssist specializes in natural language search for home listing platforms.
- Founder Chris McGoldrick will lead AI at Inside Real Estate, maintaining operations in Auckland.
- Founded in late 2022, ListAssist serves approximately 40,000 real estate agents across North America through partnerships with companies like Howard Hanna and RE/MAX's Ashton Real Estate Group.

items.title: Telegram founder Durov temporarily leaves France, source says
items.summary:
- Pavel Durov, founder of Telegram, has temporarily left France for Dubai after receiving approval from an investigating judge on Mar. 15.
- He faced legal issues in France related to alleged failures to prevent extremist content on Telegram.
- Durov had been detained at a Paris airport in August 2024 and released on €5 million bail, previously under a travel ban.
- Recent modifications to his judicial supervision allowed him to leave France for a few weeks.
- A statement from Telegram is anticipated but has not yet been issued.

items.title: Swiss-Indian agritech firm buys Fasal’s fresh food business
items.summary:
- Innoterra, a Swiss-Indian agritech platform, has acquired Fasal's fresh food distribution business for an undisclosed amount.
- This acquisition aims to enhance Innoterra’s B2B ecommerce platform, Farmlink, expanding its supply chain in Bengaluru and Chandigarh.
- The deal allows Innoterra to utilize Fasal’s network of 85,000 horticulture farmers and diversify into non-perishable goods like rice and spices, potentially broadening its customer base.

items.title: Hyundai, Kia lead South Korea’s EV market with 70.4% share
items.summary:
- Hyundai Motor and Kia captured a combined 70.4% of South Korea's EV market in February, an increase from 60.1% the previous year.
- The share of imported EV brands fell to 26.4%, down from 34.9% in the previous year.
- Hyundai sold 5,346 EVs in February, an eightfold increase compared to the previous year, driven by 1,473 IONIQ 5 and over 1,000 Casper Electric sales.
- Kia sold 4,666 EVs, nearly quadrupling its sales from the same month last year, with the EV3 compact SUV being the top seller.

items.title: Turkey Investigates Major Streaming Platforms
items.summary:
- The Turkish Competition Board is investigating major streaming services including Netflix, Disney+, Amazon, BluTV, Exxen, and Gain.
- The investigation was announced on March 16, following a preliminary inquiry.
- The focus is to assess potential anti-competitive practices and violations of competition laws, particularly regarding exclusive agreements or restrictive measures.

items.title: Tencent’s academy empowers Hong Kong students with AI skills
items.author: Dowson Tong
items.summary:
- Tencent launched WeTech Academy in Hong Kong for AI and programming education on Mar. 15, 2025.
- The initiative aims to align with Hong Kong's technological integration objectives.
- The academy will collaborate with schools, social organizations, and businesses for learning opportunities.
- Programs will include competitions and projects to help students address societal needs.
- This initiative supports broader goals of innovation and entrepreneurship in Hong Kong.

items.title: Cambodia eyes the big leagues after Grab bets on local firm
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Grab acquired local on-demand startup Nham24 in December 2024, marking an important milestone for Cambodia's tech scene.
- CEO of Aquarii BD Cambodia, Michael Tan, noted that the acquisition was long overdue, as he suggested Grab invest in Nham24 back in 2017.
- The delay in the deal reflects the underestimation of Cambodia's tech ecosystem by regional and global players.
- Cambodia’s low market saturation may offer fertile ground for startups seeking first-mover advantages despite the country's lagging macroeconomic environment.

items.title: SpaceX’s Starship to reach Mars by 2026: Elon Musk
items.author: Elon Musk
items.summary:
- SpaceX CEO Elon Musk announced Starship is set to reach Mars by the end of 2026, carrying Tesla’s humanoid robot, Optimus.
- Potential human landings may happen by 2029 or 2031 depending on mission outcomes.
- Starship has completed its eighth test launch in Texas and is vital for SpaceX’s Mars colonization and satellite launch objectives.
- Optimus is expected to achieve factory-level task capabilities by the end of 2024.
- The development of Starship enhances SpaceX’s commercial satellite sector presence and long-term space exploration goals.

items.title: Dubai robotics firm Micropolis raises $15.5m in New York IPO
items.summary:
- Micropolis, a robotics firm based in Dubai, successfully raised $15.5 million through an IPO in New York.
- The IPO marks a significant step for the company as it seeks to expand its operations and market presence.
- This financial milestone reflects growing interest and investment in the robotics sector.

items.title: Cambridge university launches VR for public speaking practice
items.summary:
- Cambridge University introduces a virtual reality (VR) platform for students to practice public speaking.
- The VR experience aims to simulate real-life speaking environments, allowing users to improve their skills.
- This initiative is part of the university's efforts to enhance learning tools through technology.

items.title: Introducing Humble Bundle: built by and for Asia’s tech players
Tech giants lose $2.7t as Tesla, Nvidia hit hardest
Get near-instant insights on Tech in Asia with Go Deeper Q&As
PayMongo may raise fresh capital in early 2026, CEO says
Abu Dhabi fund invests in US AI life sciences startup
Israeli cybersecurity startup raises $65m in stealth mode
OpenAI, Musk fast-track trial over AI for-profit shift
Ola Electric faces insolvency petition over payment dispute
items.summary:
- Rosmerta Digital Services has filed a petition to the NCLT for insolvency proceedings against Ola Electric Technologies for alleged payment defaults.
- The petition was submitted under Section 9 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016.
- Ola Electric Technologies is contesting the claims and plans to take necessary steps to defend its position.
- The issue arises amid ongoing negotiations between Ola Electric and Rosmerta Digital Services and Shimnit India, impacting vehicle registration processes.
- In February, Ola Electric's vehicle registrations dropped over 65% to 8,390 units, although they claimed sales were over 25,000 units during the same period.
